I love the Periodic Table song. I listened to it and learned it in less than three days. Now every time I see anything related to the Periodic Table, I just say the elements as fast as I can. We haven't learned it in school yet, though it should be coming soon. Other 7th graders just don't understand the awesomeness of science.
Hydrogen and Helium, Lithium, Beryllium, Boron, Carbon, Nitrogen, Oxygen, Florine, Neon, Sodium, Magnesium, Aluminum, Silicon, Phosphorus, Sulfur, Chlorine, Argon, Potassium, Scandium, Titanium, Vanadium, Chromium Manganese, skip 26-88, Actinium, Thorium, Protactinium, Uranium, Neptunium, Plutonium, Americium, Curium, Berkelium, Californium, Einsteinium, Fermium, Mendelevium, Nobelium, Lawrencium, Rutherfordium, Dubnium, Seaborgium, Borium, Hassium, Meitnerium, Darmstadtium, Unununium, Ununbium, Ununtrium, Ununquadium, Ununpentium,
Ununseptium Ununoctium.
(The end has been updated so it is not totally accurate)

I love how I know what some of the things in the song means like:
1. The scientific method
2. Mutations- "Be my C and I'll be your G or you can be my A and I'll be the T" or something like that. Then it goes on to say something about " if we ever have a mutation we could fix it together." This relates to DNA (for those who don't know) because C is an abbreviation for Cytosine, and G is Guanine and these fit together as bases for DNA. A (adenine) and T (thymine) are also bases and fit together, but if the bases get mixed up like A with C, (mostly because of radiation) can cause a mutation that could change your physical appearance. There are many more, but I thought it was pretty great considering I'm only 13.
